title: Expert-Novice Comparative Analysis Microlearning for Acquiring Visual Cognitive Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: A course for pre-service/in-service elementary teachers to systematically acquire visual cognitive skills in mobile environments, focusing on visualizing complex mathematical concepts and recognizing students' error patterns

learning_goals: Learners analyze math problem-solving processes using ≥5 visual cognitive strategies.
By mimicking expert-level gaze patterns, learners focus ≥80% of attention on key elements when evaluating student work.
Applying knowledge-based shortcuts, learners diagnose complex math problems within three steps.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
